content.question: A cart of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> rolls past the circular bottom of a hill (point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math>). Which of the following statements about the normal force <math alttext="F sub n" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></math> exerted on the cart at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math> is correct?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub n equals m g" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></math>, because the normal force on an incline is equal to <math alttext="m g times the cosine of theta" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>cos</mi><mspace width="0.1em"></mspace><mi>θ</mi></math> and <math alttext="theta equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math>.

<math alttext="F sub n equals m g" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></math>, because the speed of the cart is neither increasing nor decreasing at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math>.

<math alttext="F sub n" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></math> is equal to the centripetal force on the cart at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math>, because only the track can exert a force toward the center of the circle.

<math alttext="F sub n" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></math> is greater than <math alttext="m g" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></math> at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math>, because the cart is experiencing an upward acceleration.

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub n" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>n</mi></msub></math> is greater than <math alttext="m g" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></math> at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi>P</mi></math>, because the cart is experiencing an upward acceleration.
